justification: The Methods note that "we administered RWA (11 items; Altemeyer, 1981)", indicating the construct was assessed with the standard multi-item RWA scale.
Participants completed "SDO (16 items; Pratto et al., 1994)", showing SDO was measured with the established 16-item instrument.

measured_by: single-item self-placement on social issues continuum
justification: The study used "the self-placement on a social conservatism continuum (1 item; 'In general, how would you describe yourself with regard to your position on social issues?')" to operationalize social conservatism.

measured_by: single-item self-placement on economic issues continuum
justification: Economic conservatism was assessed via "the self-placement on an economic conservatism continuum (1 item; 'In general, how would you describe yourself with regard to your position on economic issues?')."
A "reworded version of Frederick's (2005) and Toplak et al.'s (2014) cognitive reflection test (CRT) was assessed as an indicator of rationality," linking reflective thinking to the CRT.
In Study 2, "participants completed the Ammons Quick Test … The percentage of correct answers is used as an index for cognitive ability," identifying this test as the measure of cognitive ability.

measured_by: single 7-point preference rating after reading two policy descriptions
justification: After reading descriptions of the two diversity policies, "participants were asked to indicate which policy they preferred on a scale from 1 (strongly prefer policy 1) to 7 (strongly prefer policy 2)", providing the measure of their relative preference.
